title: How to Find and Manage Your Address Book in Gmail

steps.title: Sync your contacts.
steps.content: Sync your contacts. You can access your Gmail contacts using the Google Contacts app. First, you’ll want to sync your contacts. Use the following steps to do so: [1] X Research source Swipe down from the top of the screen. Tap the Gear icon to open the Settings menu. Tap Google . Tap the All services tab. Tap Google Contacts sync . Tap Also sync device contacts . Ensure Automatically back up & sync device contacts is on. Select the Gmail account you want to backup below “Backup account.”

steps.title: Open the Google Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Google Contacts app. It has a white icon with a blue silhouette of a person. Tap the Google Contacts app to open it. If you don’t have the Google Contacts app installed on your device, you can download it from the Google Play Store for free.

steps.title: Tap the drop-down menu at the top.
steps.content: Tap the drop-down menu at the top. You should see a drop-down menu next to an icon that resembles two people. This displays a list of Google accounts connected to your Android.

steps.title: Make sure "All Contacts" or your Gmail account is selected.
steps.content: Make sure "All Contacts" or your Gmail account is selected. If another option is selected, switch it to the account associated with your Gmail address or the All contacts setting so your Gmail contacts appear. Once you do this, your Gmail address book contacts will be easy to find in your Contacts.

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings . Look for the Settings cog icon on your home screen. It resembles two silver gears. To view your Gmail address book in your iPhone's Contacts app, you'll need to make sure your Google contacts are set to sync to your phone.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . It's at the bottom of your Settings.

steps.title: Tap Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Contacts . This has an address book icon. Your Contacts settings will appear.

steps.title: Tap Contacts Accounts at the top.
steps.content: Tap Contacts Accounts at the top. A list of all accounts synced to your iPhone will appear.

steps.title: Tap your Gmail account.
steps.content: Tap your Gmail account. A list of all synced and unsynced items will appear. If you haven't added your Gmail account to your iPhone, it won't appear here. To add it now, tap Add Account , select Google , and follow the on-screen instructions to sign in. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure the "Contacts" toggle is on.
steps.content: Make sure the "Contacts" toggle is on. It will be green when on. If it's not green, tap the switch to turn it on.

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. Look at the bottom of the home screen for a green icon with a white phone.

steps.title: Tap Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Contacts . It is in the center with a person icon. This displays your contacts, where you will find all of your contacts, including iPhone contacts. Contacts from your Gmail address book are also included in this list once synced.

steps.title: Display only Gmail contacts.
steps.content: Display only Gmail contacts. If you only want to see contacts from your Gmail address book, you can do so from here: Tap Lists on the top-left to view your contact lists. Tap All Gmail to view your Gmail address book.

steps.title: Go to mail.google.com or www.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to mail.google.com or www.google.com in a web browser. You can access Google Apps from your Gmail account, the main Google homepage, or any other Google service on the internet. If you're not already signed in to your Gmail account, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now.

steps.title: Click the Apps icon.
steps.content: Click the Apps icon. It’s the icon with nine dots arranged in a 3x3 pattern in the upper-right corner of the Google or Gmail home page. This displays the Apps menu.

steps.title: Click Contacts.
steps.content: Click Contacts . It has an icon that resembles a blue silhouette of a person. This displays your Gmail address book, where you find all of your Google contacts.

steps.title: Go to mail.google.com in a web browser on your computer.
steps.content: Go to mail.google.com in a web browser on your computer. You can use any browser on your computer, such as Safari or Chrome, to access Gmail. If you're not already signed in to your Gmail account, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now.

steps.title: Click the icon that resembles a blue silhouette of a person.
steps.content: Click the icon that resembles a blue silhouette of a person. It’s in the sidebar to the right. This displays your Gmail contacts. If you don’t see the sidebar to the right, click the icon resembling an arrow pointing left ( < ) in the lower-right corner to make the sidebar appear.

steps.title: Go to contacts.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to contacts.google.com in a web browser. You can use any web browser on a computer or mobile device. If you're not already signed in to your Gmail account, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now.

steps.title: Add a contact.
steps.content: Add a contact. To add a contact to your Gmail address book: Click Create contact in the upper-left corner. Click Create a contact in the drop-down menu. Enter their first and last name, work and job title, email address, phone number, and birthday. You can also add any notes you want to add. Click Save in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Delete a contact.
steps.content: Delete a contact. To delete a contact, hover your mouse cursor over the contact you want to delete. Click the icon with three dots ( ⋮ ) to the right of the contact. Then click Delete in the menu. To delete multiple contacts, click the checkbox to the left of the contacts you want to delete. Then click the icon with three dots ( ⋮ ) in the upper-right corner above your contacts list. Then click Delete .

steps.title: Merge duplicate contacts.
steps.content: Merge duplicate contacts. To merge duplicate contacts, click Merge & fix in the menu bar to the left. Then click Merge duplicates . Review the duplicates that have been found and click Merge in the box to the left.

steps.title: Add labels to contacts.
steps.content: Add labels to contacts. You can use labels to group contacts in your address book. To create a new label: Click the plus sign ( + ) next to “Labels” in the menu bar to the left. Enter a name for the label and click Save . To assign a contact to a label, hover over a contact with your mouse cursor and click the icon with three dots ( ⋮ ) to the right of the contact. Click the label you wish to assign to that contact. Click the labels in the menu to the left to sort your contacts by label.
